messages.subject: Hi everyone!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! I know that so far I’ve been quite an inactive member, but yes, I did enjoy those first few days among you. I think that the two ML and the website are
messages.messageBody:
Hi!

I know that so far I�ve been quite an inactive member, but yes, I did enjoy those first few days among you. I think that the two ML and the website are very nice ideas and that they�ll certainly help us, Shinsengumi fans, to easily access tons of information. I�m amaze by how fast everything is getting organised and I really appreciate reading all of those posts, even if sometimes, I wonder how I�m going to find the time to read them all. The ML have been quite busy, but that�s not a bad thing at all. (^-^)

If I can, I�ll try, in the future, to add my little contribution. But I�m probably not as often on the Internet as some of you�

Tiffany� Thanks for putting my fics in the database: it is very appreciated. (^-^)

See you,
Mary-Ann



---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?
Yahoo! Finance Tax Center - File online. File on time.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Shinsengummies?
messages.msgSnippet: ... The name of that story was Rurouni Bishonen: Saitou s 34th Birthday by Midori-chan. The link is: http://www.fanfiction.net/read.php?storyid=1254492 I ve
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/30/2004 6:43:22 PM Eastern Standard Time, bsher213@... writes:

> I laughed when I read this because there's a fic on ff.net that has
> Hijikata of all people hawking Shinsengumi related merchandise and one
> of those things is---Shinsengummies! I believe they were sake flavored.
> *smirk*
>
> I think Saitou would be Soba flavored!
>
> Okita--lollipop cherry
>
> Hijikata----black licorice or sour apple
>
> Yamanami--something bland like oatmeal
>
> Kondou---something equally bland---overcooked unflavored
> rice
>
> I'm not sure on the others
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --
> Barbara Sheridan
>
> http://www.barbarasheridan.net

The name of that story was Rurouni Bishonen: Saitou's 34th Birthday by Midori-chan. The link is:
http://www.fanfiction.net/read.php?storyid=1254492

I've put it up in the database also. Oh, and for the record, only Hijikata was sake flavored. Saito was bumbleberry flavored.

I have this one up in the database too, but I'm going to sing its praises here. Nigihayami Haruko wrote a few poems dedicated to the Shinsengumi called To the Forgotten Dreams.
http://www.fanfiction.net/read.php?storyid=1604085
I hope all of you will take a peak at least.

messages.subject: Re: Shinsengumi fic on ff.net Database
messages.msgSnippet: hmmm...I don t think it allows for html...anyways we should start something similar for the shinsengumihq.com seeing how its commanders have written some of
messages.messageBody:
hmmm...I don't think it allows for html...anyways we should start
something similar for the shinsengumihq.com seeing how its commanders
have written some of the best fics. I have read probably one hundred
stories...I chose some of the more popular ones and I'll add more when
time permits...I have to search Saito, Saitou, Saitoh, Fujita
Goro/Gorou, Shinsengumi etc yep there are too many and plenty of guest
appearances of S.H. in Aoshi stories too. I think the database can
encompass Meiji Era as well because many "flashback" to the days of
the revolution.

yeah, just in case there are some tech. difficulties atleast people
will see the root address.

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "spiritus_saitou" <spiritus_saitou@y...>
wrote:
> Way cool, Tiffany! Wonder if there's a way to get it to create links
> for the location ID so all one would have to do is click on it and
> PRESTO (assuming ff.net isn't down at the time). Probably not
> just 'cause that would be too efficient. :-) I assume you were
> hoping it would create links when you created the table? (Looks like
> it since you have the full URL for them.)
>
> Just out of curiosity, what criteria did you use for including a
> story in the database? There must be hundreds (over a thousand?)
> that involve Saitou. Is it only when the story involves the
> revolutionary time period or other members of the Shinsengumi?
> (uh... I think what I'm trying to get at is "Saitou other than just a
> Meiji cop"?)
>
> You should post a message over on SHQSD for newcomers to bump into if
> they read past messages so they'll know it's there. I think so far
> most people on SHQSD are on this list, too (which I'm really glad
> of), but there are always exceptions.
>
> Thanks for starting it up!
> phil
>
> -- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Tiffany" <makoto@s...> wrote:

> > http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SHQ_Spy_Division/
> > everyone can add records

messages.subject: Re: Shinsengumi fic on ff.net Database
messages.msgSnippet: Way cool, Tiffany!  Wonder if there s a way to get it to create links for the location ID so all one would have to do is click on it and PRESTO (assuming
messages.messageBody:
Way cool, Tiffany! Wonder if there's a way to get it to create links
for the location ID so all one would have to do is click on it and
PRESTO (assuming ff.net isn't down at the time). Probably not
just 'cause that would be too efficient. :-) I assume you were
hoping it would create links when you created the table? (Looks like
it since you have the full URL for them.)

Just out of curiosity, what criteria did you use for including a
story in the database? There must be hundreds (over a thousand?)
that involve Saitou. Is it only when the story involves the
revolutionary time period or other members of the Shinsengumi?
(uh... I think what I'm trying to get at is "Saitou other than just a
Meiji cop"?)

You should post a message over on SHQSD for newcomers to bump into if
they read past messages so they'll know it's there. I think so far
most people on SHQSD are on this list, too (which I'm really glad
of), but there are always exceptions.

Thanks for starting it up!
phil

-- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Tiffany" <makoto@s...> wrote:
> I started a database at
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/SHQ_Spy_Division/
> everyone can add records

messages.subject: Shinsengumi fic on ff.net Database
messages.msgSnippet: -gasp- I scan ff.net nearly every night after I do my homework for Shinsengumi, Saitou&Tokio, or Aoshi (when I m feeling meditative) fiction...I missed this
messages.messageBody:
-gasp- I scan ff.net nearly every night after I do my homework for
Shinsengumi, Saitou&Tokio, or Aoshi (when I'm feeling meditative)
fiction...I missed this one...I started a Database of all ff.net
Shinsengumi related stories.

> I laughed when I read this because there's a fic on ff.net that has
> Hijikata of all people hawking Shinsengumi related merchandise and one
> of those things is---Shinsengummies! I believe they were sake
flavored.
> *smirk*

messages.subject: Re: Shinsengummies?
messages.msgSnippet: Wow, I just imagined how they would look like, it would have the signature jagged edge design...each package filled with multicolored/flavored Shinsengummies,
messages.messageBody:
Wow, I just imagined how they would look like, it would have the
signature jagged edge design...each package filled with
multicolored/flavored Shinsengummies, with complimentary temporary
makoto tattoos, and a contest to vote for the next Shinsengummy color
for Nagakura.

PMK Saitou...since soba flavor may be a bit hard to replicate, I'd
settle for seaweed flavor

gummy RK Saitou would be an attractive neon blue color and therein
lies the trap...it would be Tylenol flavored

Hijikata DEFINATELY black licorice

Kenshin...wild cherry

Blonde Ninja girl...bubblegum

Tatsu...salty (for all those tears he cries)

Okita...watermelon

Shishio...crunchy charcoal

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "nakkinomiko12" <LMTame@w...> wrote:
> Okay, this is totally silly, but my husband and I were chatting
about the fact that they'll make *anything* into gummy candy these
days, and then he came up with a completely evil idea:
Shinsengummies. (For the record, I thwapped him upside the head for
this.)
>
> Anyway, if there really were Shinsengummy candy, what flavor would
Saitou be?
>
> --L.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Shinsengummies?
messages.msgSnippet: Honestly, I was thinking in the terms of something slightly more citrus flavored... You know, he is so acidic (at least the RK incarnation)... (I left the rest
messages.messageBody:
Honestly, I was thinking in the terms of something slightly more citrus flavored... You know, he is so acidic (at least the RK incarnation)... (I left the rest of the citrus associations to your imagination) mwahahahahahaha!!!!
*runs with a maniacal smirk plastered in her face*
Firuze
----- Original Message -----
From: LMTame@...
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, March 30, 2004 8:45 PM
Subject: Re: [SHQ] Shinsengummies?


Of course he would be Soba flavored! Why didn't I think of that. :-P

(And sorry for the triple posting . . . had some tecnichal difficultie
i.e. user error! :-P )

--L.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Shinsengummies?
messages.msgSnippet: I laughed when I read this because there s a fic on ff.net that has Hijikata of all people hawking Shinsengumi related merchandise and one of those things
messages.messageBody:
I laughed when I read this because there's a fic on ff.net that has
Hijikata of all people hawking Shinsengumi related merchandise and one
of those things is---Shinsengummies! I believe they were sake flavored.
*smirk*

I think Saitou would be Soba flavored!

Okita--lollipop cherry

Hijikata----black licorice or sour apple

Yamanami--something bland like oatmeal

Kondou---something equally bland---overcooked unflavored rice

I'm not sure on the others






--
Barbara Sheridan

http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Shinsengummies?
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, this is totally silly, but my husband and I were chatting about the fact that they ll make *anything* into gummy candy these days, and then he came up
messages.messageBody:
Okay, this is totally silly, but my husband and I were chatting about the fact that they'll make *anything* into gummy candy these days, and then he came up with a completely evil idea: Shinsengummies. (For the record, I thwapped him upside the head for this.)

Anyway, if there really were Shinsengummy candy, what flavor would Saitou be?

--L.
